column4: my benq external 22'  monitor is not recognised properly by ubuntu, it's giving me 1600X900 while its capability is 1900*1080
i tried fedora11 yesterday and it recognised the monitor properly, what should i do ?
cmdline: xrandr
: http://pastebin.com/m1e32b5ca
does the latest fedora use a new xorg? The pastebin shows xorg is seeing 1600 as you said
with fedora10 i used to get same 1600:900 just like ubuntu however i have no idea why fedora11 recognised my complete resolution :( , the model of monitor is benq 2220 HD
seems fedora 11 must have a newer version of x11. Looking into it. You might get a ppa build for Intrepid
pardon me for my ignorance but i didn't understood the concept , what exactly is ppa ?
repository for very new software versions
bazhang: ubottu: thanks
are you able to download and try the karmic alpha? Using a pre-release version of xorg is possibly not a good idea. I think either use karmic or fedora :/
there is a comparison http://lxer.com/module/newswire/ext_link.php?rid=121790
will trying carmic alpha will be good ?
I havn't tried it.
4096 x 4096?? that cant be right?
i was expecting it gives me 1900X1080 but since it was maximum so i thought maybe ,..however it seems odd
you can use xrandr -s to set the resolution
check man xrandr
checking it (however i was used to the OS taking my resolution by default)
xrand -s 1.5 sets resolution to 1024X768, xrand -s 2 sets it to 832X624 and xrand -s 0.5 hav no effect at all ..the resolution remains as 1280X800
xrandr -s 1600x1700
: 'Size 1600x1700 not found in available modes
